intro: Daphniphyllum glaucescens subsp. sumatraense, commonly known as the Sumatran silverleaf, is a species of evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that often have a bluish tint. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by bright red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
